definition[0]: someone who influences society’s opinions about what is stylish, socially acceptable etc
example[0]: The designer has received rave reviews from such arbiters of taste as ‘Elle’ magazine.
definition[1]: someone or something that settles an argument between two opposing sides
example[1]: The European Court of Justice will be the final arbiter (=make the final decision) in the dispute.
definition[2]: a person or organization with the authority to decide how something should be done
example[2]: The Food and Drug Administration is the final arbiter of food labeling.
definition[3]: a person or organization that tries to find solutions to disagreements
example[3]: Businessmen here often hire freelance arbiters to settle disputes.
